intro_summary: Before closing, here's a summary of the main questions we answered about CDC:

a1.title: ‚ùì What is CDC and why know it?
a1.text: ‚úÖ Answer: CDC (Law No. 8,078/90) protects consumers and ensures fair consumption relations. Knowing it is essential to:

a2.title: ‚ùì When can the customer exchange a product without defect?
a2.l1: Physical store: CDC does NOT require exchange - it's a commercial policy (courtesy)
a2.l2: Online store: Customer has Right of Withdrawal (up to 7 calendar days after receipt)

a3.title: ‚ùì When there's a defect, what's the procedure?
a3.text: ‚úÖ Answer: The supplier has up to 30 days to fix via technical assistance. If not resolved, customer can opt for:
a3.note: Deadline to complain: 90 days for durable products.

a4.title: ‚ùì How to forward product complaints?
a4.l1: Food: Customer brings product + receipt to store (management evaluation)
a4.l2: Non-food: Product + receipt to store (except Appliances ‚Üí Technical Assistance)
a4.l3: Wrong purchase: Non-perishables can be exchanged if unopened; perishables we don't exchange

quiz_final.question: After this entire journey, you receive a new colleague on the team who asks: 'In the end, what's most important here?'. Which answer best summarizes the CS mission we learned?
quiz_final.opt_a: A) 'The most important thing is to respond fast to hit the time target, whether it's resolved or not.'
quiz_final.feedback_wrong_a: Speed without resolution generates dissatisfaction. The customer wants their problem solved, not just to be served quickly. Time metrics are important, but not the main goal.
quiz_final.opt_b: B) 'The important thing is to follow the law rigorously so the company doesn't get sued, the rest is detail.'
quiz_final.feedback_wrong_b: Following the law is fundamental, but not sufficient. CS goes beyond: seeks delight, loyalty and relationship building. Law is the minimum, excellence is the goal.
quiz_final.opt_c: C) 'Our mission is to be the strategic bridge between company and customer, solving problems with efficiency, humanity and respect for laws.'
quiz_final.opt_d: D) 'The main focus is to avoid at all costs the customer asking to speak with management.'
quiz_final.feedback_wrong_d: Avoiding escalation is not the goal - it is a consequence of good service. If the customer needs to speak with management, it is not necessarily a failure. The focus should be on solving the problem.
quiz_final.feedback: Correct Answer! You captured the essence of Customer Service! üëèüëèüëè

a6.title: ‚ùì What is the deadline for exchanging perishables online?
a6.text: ‚úÖ Answer: Perishable products with short shelf life (meats, produce, bakery, cold cuts, dairy) bought online have a special deadline of 24 hours after delivery.
a6.attention: ‚ö†Ô∏è This ensures food safety for the customer and company.
a6.note: Different from the 7 days of Right of Withdrawal, which applies to non-perishable products.

a7.title: ‚ùì What are the best practices for quality service?
a7.l1: üëÇ Active Listening: Listen attentively without interrupting
a7.l2: üîç Complete Probing: Ask questions to understand the situation
a7.l3: üíö Cordiality and Empathy: Be kind and understanding
a7.l4: üìù Precise Recording: Document all data correctly
a7.note: These practices ensure clear, organized and rework-free service.
